t: Proverbs 11
Dishonest*pn scales are*i an abomination to the Lord,*s But*ld a just weight is*i His delight.
When*ln pride comes, then comes shame; But*ld with the humble is*i wisdom.
The*ln integrity of the upright will guide them, But*ld the perversity of the unfaithful will destroy them.
Riches*ld do not profit in the day of wrath, But*ld righteousness delivers from death.
The*ld righteousness of the blameless will direct his way aright, But*ld the wicked will fall by his own wickedness.
The*ld righteousness of the upright will deliver them, But*ld the unfaithful will be caught by their*i lust.
When*ln a wicked man dies, his*i expectation will perish, And*ld the hope of the unjust perishes.

The*ld hypocrite with his*i mouth destroys his neighbor, But*ld through knowledge the righteous will be delivered.

He*ln who is devoid of wisdom despises his neighbor, But*ld a man of understanding holds his peace.
A*ln talebearer reveals secrets, But*ld he who is of a faithful spirit conceals a matter.
Where*ln there*i is*i no counsel, the people fall; But*ld in the multitude of counselors there*i is*i safety.

The*ld wicked man*i does deceptive work, But*ld he who sows righteousness will*i have*i a sure reward.
